File libsrc/libgparse/GParseError.c

Routines for handling libgparse error messages.

GParseSetErrorMsg is used mainly inside libGParse to store messages in a static location that will be returned by GParseErrMsg.

GParseErrMsg is used after calls to libGParse routines to retrieve the most recent error message.

The following errors can be generated by libGParse: 

      Error-Code                         Error
  GParse_BAD_PATH        GParse cannot open the CD receiver directory.
  GParse_NULL_PATH       The path argument to GParseOpen is NULL.
  GParse_BAD_STATION     Invalid station name input to GParseAddChannel.
  GParse_BAD_CHANNEL     Invalid channel name input to GParseAddChannel.
  GParse_OPEN_DIR_ERR    Cannot open a database directory.
  GParse_STAT_FILE_ERR   Cannot stat a file in the database.
  GParse_OPENR_FILE_ERR  Cannot open a file for reading.
  GParse_OPENW_FILE_ERR  Cannot open a file for writing.
  GParse_GParseReadCD_ERR   The default author directory does not exist.
  GParse_GParseSeek_ERR     Error seeking in a file.
  GParse_REACQUIRE_ERR   CD reacquire error.
  GParse_NO_TIME         Cannot determine the time for a table creation.
  GParse_IMPORT_ERR      Cannot open an import file or directory.
  GParse_PTHREAD_ERR     A call to pthread_create failed.
  GParse_SEM_INIT_ERR    A call to sem_init failed.
  GParse_SEM_POST_ERR    A call to sem_post failed.
  GParse_JOIN_ERR        A call to pthread_join failed.
  GParse_MALLOC_ERR      A call to malloc failed.

Public Function Index

GParseErrMsg ()
Get a libGParse error message.
GParseErrno ()
Get a libGParse error number.

Public Functions

GParseErrMsg 
 char *GParseErrMsg()
Get a libGParse error message.

Returns:
the most recent libGParse error message.
GParseErrno 
 int GParseErrno()
Get a libGParse error number.
